title: [K-12] Community of Practice (CoP)-Based Online Learning Program for Pre-service Teacher Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic teaching-learning theories and elementary educational environments
context.additional_context: Emphasis on practical educational experiences based on sociocultural learning theory. Construction of collaborative learning environments using digital devices.

learning_goals: Enhance collaborative problem-solving competencies among pre-service teachers through community of practice activities

Learners can create a personalized development roadmap with three practical plans for improving field adaptability (e.g., mastering work procedures, peer collaboration strategies) and two professional development goals (e.g., obtaining certifications, acquiring skills) through biweekly feedback sessions with mentor teachers.

Learners can achieve over 80% performance standards in four of five teacher competency areas (lesson preparation, student management, assessment design, etc.) through a three-month project-based evaluation (classroom management simulation, lesson design, etc.) at a vocational training institution.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
